here we go then loss words and phrases there are 
many ways of looking at this particular word many

ways of using this word as well so we are going 
to have a look at some words and phrases that

we can use connected to the subject of loss 
the word loss is a noun that means the fact

or process of losing something or someone so the 
word loss can relate to a thing or a person so

something that was there and now is not can leave 
you with that feeling and the feeling is loss

the amount of money lost by a 
business or organization is a loss

we often describe money that has been 
lost as part of the profit of a company

the loss is the amount lost during a certain 
period of time so we often think of loss as

i suppose another word you could use is 
deficit deficit so the loss is the amount

of money that you've spent extra but you 
have not made that money back it is loss

the deep feeling of grief experienced 
after losing someone or something of value

so the feeling of loss we might describe it as 
an emotion and i think that would be fair to say

that loss is an emotion it is the feeling 
of grief and maybe you have lost something

maybe a possession maybe something that belongs to 
you that is treasured or valuable or maybe it has

some sentimental value so perhaps it isn't 
worth much money maybe it isn't valuable

but to you it is it has sentimental value 
so the deep feeling of grief experienced

after losing someone or something of value 
i will never get over the loss of my mother

it is hard to forget the loss of my pet something 
that means a lot to you something that has value

in terms of money or in terms of emotional 
connection can be described as loss

in singular form a person or thing 
that is badly missed when lost

but you are not making any money from the

into the business but unfortunately you are not 
making it back you are not making the money back

to lose out on something is to be deprived

of an opportunity then you can say

to have a sudden loss of earnings so in that

you have a sudden loss of earnings

to lose is to suddenly be without 
something an item you own disappears
lose is the action lost is the past tense

you will lose your phone if you are not careful
